thread.title: Leeds United 1-0 Derby County: Chris Wood strike fires Garry Monk's men up to third
thread.title_full: Leeds United 1-0 Derby County: Chris Wood strike fires Garry Monk's men up to third

author: Nathan Hemmingham
title: Leeds United 1-0 Derby County: Chris Wood strike fires Garry Monk's men up to third
text:
Monk's men keep on rolling (Photo: PA) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Chris Wood fired Leeds up to third in the Championship with his 17th goal of the season 
The striker was the difference between two of the division’s promotion chasers in a thrilling encounter at Elland Road, as Leeds eked out a 1-0 win against Derby. 
It’s 13 years since the Yorkshire outfit was last in the Premier League but under the guidance of Gary Monk this season is proving their best since that disastrous 2004 campaign. 
Under Monk, Leeds have already won more games than they did in the whole of last season and look strong favourites to maintain their top six position. Wood finds the net with his header (Photo: PA) Monk's men continue to climb the table (Photo: Getty Images Europe) A moments applause before kick off in honour of Graham Taylor (Photo: PA) 
The home side would have been ahead as early as the eighth minute but for an excellent clearing header by Derby skipper Richard Keogh, who diverted Pablo Hernandez’s right-wing cross over the bar with in-form striker Wood ready to pounce for a certain goal. 
Derby keeper Scott Carson, returning to the club where he kicked off his professional career, then denied Liam Bridcutt and Kyle Bartley with two saves in the space of a minute as Leeds dominated. Julien De Sart and Pablo Hernandez battle for the ball (Photo: PA) 
Bartley had a real head in hands moment on 25 minutes when he somehow poked Hernandez’s corner wide of the post from only a yard out but Leeds’s pressure was eventually rewarded on the stroke of half-time when Wood headed home from another excellent Hernandez corner. 
The visitors hardly threatened Robert Green in the home goal during the first 45 minutes but the former England keeper was called into action with the last kick of the half when he tipped Tom Ince’s rasping drive over the bar. 
Derby boss Steve McClaren rang the changes at half-time and brought on Will Hughes and Matej Vydra and it sparked the visitors into life, albeit briefly. Pablo Hernandez is tackled by Bradley Johnson - who was sent off late on (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
They had the ball in the net within five minutes when Green’s clearance was charged down by Darren Bent in a nightmare moment for the keeper but referee Scott Duncan said Bent used his arms to deflect the clearance into the goal. 
Leeds could have added to their lead with Gaetano Berardi, Ronaldo Vieira and Hernandez all going close before Bradley Johnson compounded a miserable night for the visitors with his second yellow card late on. Player Ratings 
Leeds: Green 7, Coyle 7, Ayling 7, Bartley 8, Berardi 7, Bridcutt 8, Vieira 7, Roofe 8 (Dallas 6, 79), MOM Hernandez 8 (Mowatt, 87), Doukara 7, Wood 7 
Derby: Carson 7, Baird 6, Keogh 6, Shackell 6, Hanson 6, Ince 6, De Sart 5 (Hughes 6, HT), Bryson 6, Johnson 6, Camara 5 (Vydra 6, HT), Bent 6 (Nugent 6, 68)
